trial_identification.studytitle: Telmisartan in the management of abdominal aortic aneurysm
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The effects of Telmisartan, an angiotensinII type 1 receptor blocker, in reducing AAA growth in patients with abdominal aortic aneurysm.

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Diseases of the vasculature and circulation including the lymphatic system

interventions.interventions: Angiotensin II type 1 receptor blocker, oral tablet, 40mg daily for 24 months.
interventions.comparator: Placebo, sugar pill that is identical in appearance to Telmisartan but without the active ingredient.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Change in AAA growth as measured by 1) maximum diameter on ultrasound, and/or 2) maximum orthogonal diameter on computed tomographic angiography and/or 3) maximum infra-renal aortic volume on computed tomographic angiography.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Computed tomographic angiography conducted at entry, 12 and 24 months (conducted at entry and 24 months only at Leiden and Stanford study centres). Ultrasound measurement conducted at entry, 6, 12, 18 and 24 months.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Change in resting brachial blood pressure measured with sphygmomanometer
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Resting blood pressure to be measured at entry, 3, 6, 12, 18 and 24 months.
SF-36 questionnaires to be collected at entry, 12 and 24 months.
Blood collection (SST tubes x 2, EDTA tubes x 2, Citrate tube x 1, PaxGene tube x 1) to be undertaken at entry, 6, 12, 18 and 24 months.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: 1. Written informed consent 2. Infra-renal AAA measuring a maximum orthogonal diameter greater than or equal to 35mm and less than or equal to 49mm on CTA or ultrasound; 3. Stable medication regime for the last 6 months; 4. No current indication for AAA repair according to the treating physician or expectation that this will be revised within the next year; 5. High likelihood of compliance with treatment over 24 months.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Contraindications to study treatment, including: 1. renal impairment (i.e. creatinine >1.5x upper limit of normal [ULN]), 2. known significant renal stenosis (>70%) of one or both renal arteries, 3. chronic liver disease (i.e. cirrhosis or hepatitis) or abnormal liver function (i.e. ALT 1.5xULN), 4. electrolyte imbalance and 5. active gout; 6. Current or planned usage of an AT1 blocker 7. Current or planned usage of an ACE inhibitor. 8. If the patient has previously had abdominal aortic surgery

trial_design.concealment: Patients will be randomised by a blinded health professional through the secure trial website, coordinated by an independent trial centre. Random number sequences will correspond to serial numbers on concealed study packaging.
trial_design.sequence: Stratified randomisation by the online randomisation website (ccre.med.monash.edu.au/TEDYrand).

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The primary purpose of the study is to investigate telmisartan as a novel therapy for patients with abdominal aortic aneurysms. We hypothesize that telmisartan will reduce AAA growth.
ethicsAndSummary.publication: TElmisartan in the management of abDominal aortic aneurYsm (TEDY): The study protocol for a randomized controlled trial Dylan R. Morris, Margaret A. Cunningham, Anna A.
